title: Unable to connect to home assistant with url
body: I'm getting stuck after adding a bridge with the message "Unable to connect to home assistant with url". I am using https. Is that not supported? I have no problem to access the url with url from the same machine. The matter bridge is running in docker and not on the same host as Home Assistant.
author: Jost80

comments.body:
Are you using a self signed certificate with HTTPS?

JUST FOR TESTING PURPOSE:
Can you add this environment variable `NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0`
This will disable TLS verification.

NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 works. Thank you.

I am using a certificate from my own internal PKI.

Using that variable IS NOT RECOMMENDED. It actually makes the whole purpose of SSL useless.
This was just to verify that it's caused by the self signed certificate.

Actual solution:
we should tell the app that there is a self signed certificate we want to trust. We can use the public key of your HA for that, or the root public key of your CA if available.

You could mount the public key somewhere into the docker container (e.g. `/ssl/public-ha.pem`).
And then add an environment variable: `NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS=/ssl/public-ha.pem`

Please tell me if that worked.

Looks like NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS=/cert/ha-cert.pem works if ha-cert.pem contains both intermediate and root CA certificates.

All devices are listed as offline in google home though but thats probably something else. Tried with NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 again and still offline.
Yes that's a different problem: #485

title: When restarting, the Names of devices in the Alexa App will be reset
body:
Awesome project, i just installed it and i'm pretty happy with it.

However i have the problem that the names of devices will be changed back to the names assigned in home assistant. For example i have a smart plug called "living room TV" in home assistant that i want to name just "TV" in alexa. However, if i restart the bridge, the name is "living room TV" after that and the group i assigned in the alexa app is gone. On Homekit this is no issue, the names and rooms persist after a restart of HAMH. 
Is there a way to fix this?
author: drBeam

comments.body:
Which version of the addon are you currently running?
There was a bug that caused Alexa to find all devices as "new devices" everytime the addon restarts - this should be fixed with the latest version.
I'm on alpha40 and my Apple Home lost all its customisations again.

I‘m running Alpha38. I will test it with 40 tomorrow and let you know the results. :)

---

Just checked it, seems to be fixed in Alpha40. Amazing!

title: Include/Exclude by entity name
body:
Thank you for this great AddOn!

One feature I’m really missing: I'd like the ability to have all devices disabled for Alexa by default, allowing me to selectively enable specific entities or devices. Currently, it seems like I can only expose entire domains (e.g.), which then requires me to manually remove unwanted devices in the Alexa app. Is there any way to make it so that all devices are hidden by default, with an option to enable only chosen entities/devices?

Thank you for considering this feature request, and thanks for your hard work on this project!
author: Milinator

comments.body:
> > Thank you for this great AddOn!
> > 
> > One feature I’m really missing: I'd like the ability to have all devices disabled for Alexa by default, allowing me to selectively enable specific entities or devices. Currently, it seems like I can only expose entire domains (e.g.), which then requires me to manually remove unwanted devices in the Alexa app. Is there any way to make it so that all devices are hidden by default, with an option to enable only chosen entities/devices?
> > 
> > Thank you for considering this feature request, and thanks for your hard work on this project!
> 
> You can already do this 👍 
> In the example bellow, i only expose two entities :)
> 
> `{
>   "filter": {
>     "include": [
>       {
>         "type": "pattern",
>         "value": "switch.prise_chauffage_sdb_haut"
>       },
>       {
>         "type": "pattern",
>         "value": "light.prise_cheminee"
>       }
>     ],
>     "exclude": []
>   }
> }`
> 
> 
> 

Oops, thanks for that! 😅

title: Google home cannot dim nor change colour on light bulbs
body:
When I try to dim the lights in google home I get an error: "An error occurred. Please try again" or "Something went wrong". After that the dimming value returns to what was set before in HA. 

Also when I ask google assistant through a google home mini to adjust the lights dimming it says: "[light name] offline"

When I change the dimming level in HA the correct value can be seen in google home. 

Changing colours in google home does nothing. Almost behaves the same way as with dimming - try to change the colour and the toggling can be seen but it just bounces back. When I change the colour in HA then google home will not reflect that. 

Using IKEA tradfri zigbee bulbs.

title: adding to different matter hubs
body:
Maybe I got the idea of matter wrong or I am making a mistake here.
I have installed the new version via docker and it works fine after I had some problems especially when adding lights without colors (already found these here).

Now I've added my hub to google home, which didn't work via the QR code, but this might be just my problem, because the QR code worked in smartthings. After that I can easily control the device. Works really well.

Now I also wanted to add the hub to SmartThings, as I thought this is something I can do with matter. But the QR Code now has an overlay and says "Commissioned".
Is this a problem with google home or do I have to create a hub each time I want to add it to something else even if I want to use the same configuration?
author: tobiimschrank

comments.body: Just a misunderstanding from my side. got it working

yeah unfortunately you cannot use the QR code twice. that why i added an overlay. but you can use the first connected controller to share the matter hub with another controller.

e.g. with alexa you can open the alexa app and go to the hub device. there you can share the app with e.g. apple home (somewhere deep in the settings of the alexa app).

I'll still need to create the FAQs / how-tos.
This is what I am doing right now and it works like a charm (As long as I don't add a device that creates an error :D)
